column4: I'm having problems with a ubuntu server (7.04) install on an old machine. The install runs fine. When it boots up the machine brings up the login prompt but won't accept any input from the keyboard
if you press ctrl-alt-f1 does it dump you to a terminal?
ps2. it works perfectly through the whole install.
didn't try that. I thought since the login prompt came up it should accept the login
am starting up machine to try it now
ok, does the numlock light turn on and off when you press it?
an old gigabyte one. takes a socket 370 processor
i'd suggest something doesnt like the ps2 controller or the keyboard. do you have a different keyboard to test?
nope. it seems a bit strange though - the ubuntu installer didn't have any issues at all with the keyboard
do you have a ps2->usb convertor?
I'll go and have a rummage around. Will Ubuntu boot fine with a USB keyboard?
yeah, tho you may have to tell your bios not to hault on no-keyboard-found-errors
